panels.description: Number of deadlocks detected per database
panels.title: Deadlocks count (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of rows inserted by queries per database
panels.title: Rows inserted  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of rows readed by queries per database
panels.title: Rows readed  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of rows returned by queries per database
panels.title: Rows returned  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of rows deleted by queries per database
panels.title: Rows deleted  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of rows updated by queries per database
panels.title: Rows updated  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of times disk blocks were found already in the buffer cache, so that a read was not necessary (this only inclu des hits in the PostgreSQL buffer cache, not the operating system's file system cache)
panels.title: Disk blocks from buffer cache (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of transactions per database that have been committed
panels.title: Transactions committed  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of transactions per database that have been rolled back
panels.title: Transactions rolled back  (top $limit)

panels.description: Max duration in seconds any active transaction has been running
panels.title: Max active transaction duration  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of temporary files created by queries per database. All temporary files are counted, regardless of why t he temporary file was created (e.g., sorting or hashing), and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: Temporary files created (top $limit)

panels.description: Total amount of data written to temporary files by queries per database. All temporary files are counted, regar dless of why the temporary file was created, and regardless of the log_temp_files setting.
panels.title: Data written to temporary files  (top $limit)

panels.description: Number of queries canceled due to conflicts with recovery per database. (Conflicts occur only on standby servers ; see pg_stat_database_conflicts for details.)
panels.title: Number of queries canceled due to conflicts  (top $limit)
